messages.subject: New poll for samuraihistory
messages.msgSnippet: Enter your vote today!  A new poll has been created for the samuraihistory group: What do you think of the Samurai Archives Podcast so far? o I listen, and
messages.messageBody:
Enter your vote today! A new poll has been created for the
samuraihistory group:

What do you think of the Samurai Archives Podcast so far?

o I listen, and it's great, I like the way it is.
o I listen, and it's too complex
o I listen, and it's too simple
o I listen, and the content is good, but would like more discussion and analysis
o I listen, and have other suggestions (Please comment)
o I don't listen, because (Please comment)
o I don't listen because it's too dull
o I don't listen because I don't like you guys
o I disagree with your premises and conclusions (please comment)
o I pick and choose which episodes to listen to


To vote, please visit the following web page:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/samuraihistory/surveys?id=3064636

Note: Please do not reply to this message. Poll votes are
not collected via email. To vote, you must go to the Yahoo! Groups
web site listed above.

Thanks!

messages.msgSnippet: Enter your vote today!  A new poll has been created for the samuraihistory group: I think the following genre(s) would be the most interesting for the Samurai
messages.messageBody:
Enter your vote today! A new poll has been created for the
samuraihistory group:

I think the following genre(s) would be the most interesting
for the Samurai Fiction contest (you may vote for multiple
genres)

o Horror
o Sci-fi
o Comedy
o Drama
o Historically accurate fiction
o What If alternate history
o Tragedy
o Romance
o Action/Adventure
o Fantasy
o Crossover fiction (including characters from other stories, movies, etc)
o Mystery
o Twilight Zone
o Ghost Story
o Pulp Fiction


To vote, please visit the following web page:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/samuraihistory/surveys?id=1940096

Note: Please do not reply to this message. Poll votes are
not collected via email. To vote, you must go to the Yahoo! Groups
web site listed above.

Thanks!

How much of a factor were Nobunaga's
use of guns at Nagashino in Katsuyori's

o Katsuyori would have lost regardless of Nobunaga's use of guns

messages.subject: New poll for samuraihistory
messages.msgSnippet: Enter your vote today!  A new poll has been created for the samuraihistory group: Everyone knows Nobunaga was a pioneer in the unification of Japan - but what
messages.messageBody:
Enter your vote today! A new poll has been created for the
samuraihistory group:

Everyone knows Nobunaga was a pioneer in
the unification of Japan - but what were
his motives? I've created a little
poll to get everyone's opinions - What
was Nobunaga's motivation for the
unification battles of Japan?

o Pure self interest from the start.
o An honest to goodness feeling of loyalty and duty to his country.
o Self interest at first, which grew into a sense of duty.
o Started with a sense of duty to Japan, but grew into a selfish drive for power.
o Just happened to be good at winning and politics, and sort of 'fell into it'.
o Pushed by his generals and vassals to achieve.
o Reveled in death and destruction - unification would only be a side effect of his bloodlust.
o Was part of a grand conspiracy among daimyo and the emperor as the 'chosen one' to lead Japan.
o He enjoyed the thrill of battle and the thrill of political intrigue.
o Wanted nothing more than power over others.
o Fought out of loyalty to the emperor, to whom he intended to return power.
o Fought to unify Japan against the Europeans, whom he saw as a threat to the fractured country.


To vote, please visit the following web page:

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/samuraihistory/polls

Note: Please do not reply to this message. Poll votes are
not collected via email. To vote, you must go to the Yahoo! Groups
web site listed above.

Thanks!
